body:
I am planning to buy a bundle or just a mouse and a keyboard.

My crappy Acer mouse and Keyboard is all worn out, so I decided to get a gaming mouse for the side keys, and just the keyboard since mine is very worn out.

I am in a budget of about $40 or under.

I have found this on Amazon:http://www.amazon.ca/gp/aw/d/B00DKXXAAQ/ref=redir_mdp_mobile?camp=15121&creative=330641&creativeASIN...

I'm not finding the mouse and keyboard for heavy gaming, just basic minectaft PvP.

Any suggestions?

title: Gaming Mouse/Keyboard Help. (In a Budget)

replies.body:
Just get a freakin razer. Anyone would work razer OP YoLAr sWag gG10nnn eZ pz shrkt

replies.body:
http://www.amazon.com/Etekcity®-Optical-Programmable-Buttons-Switches/dp/B00F3L19KQ/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UT

http://www.amazon.com/Redragon-Karura-Keyboard-Switchable-Backlight/dp/B00LSGKEC4/ref=sr_1_4?ie=UTF8...

These would be around 41 USD, but I'm not sure about the cost of shipping. The keyboard also isn't mechanical if that's what you want you shouldn't go for it. I personally prefer silent keyboards so therefore I would go for that one.
EDIT: You could probably find a better keyboard for the same price, as the build quality doesn't seem to be too good judging by reviews.

Repsonding to this in the post 
I have found this on Amazon:http://www.amazon.ca/gp/aw/d/B00DKXXAAQ/ref=redir_mdp_mobile?camp=15121&creative=330641&creativeASIN...
I use that same mouse and keyboard (got the bundle) and they work great for me. The keyboard lights up and the mouse has 2 side buttons and an on the fly dpi change button :)

replies.body: To be honest you can't even get that good a gaming mouse for that much, just save. I used to have a gaming keyboard but it wore out. Which mouse you get depends on your grip. I use palm mainly but use claw when I want to jitterclick or have a higher clickspeed. My current mouse (Mionix Naos 3200) is really hardcore palm grip so it's hard to jitter on. If you want advice I'd say go for a cheap Razer or Logitech gaming mouse as they're both great brands.
replies.body_tagged: To be honest you can't even get that good a gaming mouse for that much, just save. I used to have a gaming keyboard but it wore out. Which mouse you get depends on your grip. I use palm mainly but use claw when I want to jitterclick or have a higher clickspeed. My current mouse (Mionix Naos 3200) is really hardcore palm grip so it's hard to jitter on. If you want advice I'd say go for a cheap Razer or Logitech gaming mouse as they're both great brands.
